text:
Raskolnikov stepped onto the stairs. 

“Wait, Rodion Romanovitch!” 

Porfiry Petrovitch chased after him, breathless. 

“I have questions. We’ll meet again, won’t we?” 

Raskolnikov turned, masking his unease. 

“Forgive my outburst, Porfiry Petrovitch.” 

“Don’t mention it! I have a wicked temper too.” 

Raskolnikov smirked. 

“Will we know each other through and through?” 

“Yes, through and through.” 

Porfiry squinted, studying him. 

“Are you going to a birthday party?” 

“To a funeral.” 

“Of course, take care of yourself.”

**PAGE SUMMARY:** Porfiry Petrovitch expresses a desire to meet Raskolnikov again to ask him questions, hinting at their complex relationship.
